intro: Tristicha trifaria, commonly known as the common spurge, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branching stems covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are borne on slender peduncles. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a waxy coating. Tristicha trifaria is known for its toxic milky sap, which can cause skin irritation and is used in traditional medicine.
